Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was placed in a restraint that was not per the facilities
restraint model technique. Staff hooked the youth's left arm and
placed the youth against the wall and stood there for 1 minute and
asked if the youth was calmed down and ready to be released.
Additional Allegation:
Youth A was placed in a restraint by Staff 2 that was not per the
facilities restraint model technique.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/30/2023. Youth A reported Youth B began talking about her
family and Youth A and Youth B got in a physical altercation. Staff
1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were present. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3
were attempting to break up the fight by separating Youth A and
Youth B. Staff separated Youth A and Youth B by restraining the
youth, putting Youth A and Youth B in separate corners of the
main area on the pod. Youth A was restrained by Staff 2 and Staff
3 and described the restraint as Staff 2 and Staff 3 “hooking” her
arms. Youth A reported her peers also tried to step in and stop
the fight between Youth A and Youth B. Youth A reported her
peers, specifically Youth D, were holding her back from fighting
Youth B. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were telling Youth A’s peers
to go back to their bedrooms. Youth A and Youth B hit one
another a few times. Youth A reported she picked up a chair at
one point during the fight and was going to throw it at Youth B
however was restrained by staff. Youth A did not recall which staff
restrained her. Youth A was unable to recall how she was
2

restrained. Youth A reported she was restrained twice during the
fight with Youth B. Youth A was asked more clarifying questions
regarding the restraints and the fight between her and Youth B
however Youth A responded several times with “I don’t remember”
or “I don’t want to talk anymore” and asked to go back to the pod.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/30/2023. Youth B was talking to Youth A and Youth A became
upset. Youth B reported she and Youth A began fighting and
Youth A attempted to throw a shelf at her. Staff 1, Staff 2, and
Staff 3 tried to stop Youth A and Youth B from fighting by
restraining both Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 attempted to
restraint Youth B however Youth B got out of the restraint and
Staff 1 held her in the corner. Youth B described this as Staff 1
standing in front of her and having his hands out on the wall with
her in between his arms with no hands touching her. Youth B did
not recall how Staff 1 tried to restrain her. Youth A was restrained
by Staff 2 and Staff 3. Staff 2 had one of Youth A’s arms and Staff
3 had Youth A’s other arm. Youth B did not recall how Staff 2 and
Staff 3 were holding Youth A’s arms. Youth A was held in the
corner by Staff 2 and Staff 3 in the restraint. Other youth on the
pod tried to stop the fighting by getting in the middle of Youth A
and Youth B. Youth B had a hard time walking through the
incident and reported she did not remember a lot of the details.
Youth B reported law enforcement came later in the morning for a
separate incident that occurred after the fight with her and Youth
A.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/30/2023. Youth C reported she did not recall many of the
details from the fight between Youth A and Youth B. Youth C
recalled Youth A being restrained however did not remember any
details of the restraint. Youth C did not remember if the other
youth on the pod were trying to break up the fight between Youth
A and Youth B. Youth C reported when youth fight, staff try to
break up the fights but was unable to explain how staff intervene.
Youth C reported law enforcement was called to the facility that
night for a separate incident that occurred after Youth A and Youth
B were fighting.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on 1/4/2024. Youth D
reported Youth A and Youth B fought daily at the facility, and it
was hard to recall specific details of each fight. Youth D did recall
a fight at night that she was present for. Youth D did recall trying
to hold Youth B back from Youth A. Youth D recalled Staff 1, Staff
2, and another staff that she did not know coming over from
3

another unit to assist. Youth D saw Youth A “pinned in the corner
by the wall” but could not recall which staff had Youth A. Youth D
reported Youth A and Youth B were both restrained several times
that evening however were able to get out of the restraints. Youth
D reported Youth A was restrained at one point by Staff 1 and
Staff 3 where Staff 1 had one of Youth A’s arms and Staff 3 had
Youth A’s other arm and they were holding Youth A against the
wall. Staff 2 attempted to restrain Youth B a few times however
was unable to. Youth D never saw Staff 1 have Youth A against
the wall by himself. Youth D recalled Youth A and Youth B trying
to throw chairs and staff being able to intervene and take the
chairs away. Youth D reported the staff were trying to intervene
and break up the fight. Youth D and the other youth on the pod
were told to not to feed into the fighting by the staff. Youth D was
trying to calm Youth A and Youth B down. Youth D had never met
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 before this incident. Youth D did not
recall specific details of the incident.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/30/2023. Administrator 1 reviewed the video of the incident.
Administrator 1 spoke with Staff 1 who informed Administrator 1
he was unable to get his arms in the correct position with Youth
A’s restraint. Staff 1 guided Youth A away from Youth B. Staff 1
had Youth A in the middle of his arms, as he had both his arms
out on the wall and Youth A was in between Staff 1’s arms. Staff 1
did not pin or push Youth A against the wall. Administrator 1
reported there were multiple attempts to restrain Youth A during
the incident that were unsuccessful.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023.Youth A and Youth B have a history of getting into
verbal and physical altercations. Youth A and Youth B were yelling
at each other. Staff 1 got between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1
was focused on Youth B and was trying to deescalate Youth B.
Youth B tried to run toward Youth A and Staff 1 got in between
Youth A and Youth B. Youth A and Youth B were trying to pull
each other’s hair. Staff 1 was using his body with his arms out to
use proximity control and move Youth B into the corner of the
living area. Staff 1 was facing Youth B. Staff 1 reported he
continued to use proximity control with Youth B to keep her
separated from Youth A as he had his arms out and was moving
with her to keep himself in between Youth B and Youth A to keep
them separated. Staff 1 did not know what was occurring with
Youth A as he was positioned facing Youth B. Staff 1 heard a
crashing noise behind him and turned to see Staff 2 trying to
restrain Youth A. Staff 2 had Youth A in a hold however Staff 1
4

was unable to recall how Staff 2 was holding Youth A. Youth A
was trying to get away from Staff 2. Youth A was able to get out of
Staff 2’s hold. Staff 1 stood in front of Youth A and put his arms
under her arms in a reverse hook position with his arms straight
out and escorted Youth A to the wall. Staff 1 had his palms on the
wall and Youth A was in between his arms. Staff 1 did not have a
hold of Youth A’s body. Staff 1 held his arms against the wall with
Youth A in between his arms for about thirty seconds until Youth A
said she was calm. Staff 1 moved his left arm and Youth A walked
to the middle of the pod. Youth B was still in the corner of the pod,
Staff 1 believed by herself. Youth A and Youth B settled down for
about a minute and then began yelling at each other again. Youth
B was in her bedroom and Youth A was in the middle of the pod.
Youth A and Youth B began to go towards each other again. Staff
1 was verbally telling Youth A and Youth B to stop. Staff 1 was
focusing on Youth B as she tends to listen more than Youth A.
Staff 1 got in the middle of Youth A and Youth B and escorted
Youth B to the corner by using proximity control with his arms out
guiding her while not touching her body. Staff 2 attempted to
restrain Youth A again however Staff 1 did not see how he
attempted to restrain her. Youth A grabbed a chair and attempted
to throw the chair at Staff 1. Staff 2 moved his arms to block the
chair from being thrown. Youth A grabbed the chair again. Staff 1
was able to get a hold of the chair and held the chair down on the
ground so Youth A could not pick the chair up to throw it again.
Youth B was still in the corner by herself. Staff 2 had a hold of
Youth A at this time however Staff 1 did not recall how Staff 2 was
holding Youth A. Staff 2 released Youth A and Youth A went and
sat on the couch. Youth B went to her bedroom. Youth C became
escalated during this time and began yelling at the youth on the
pod. Staff 1 called Administrator 2 and informed her of the
situation and Administrator 2 advised Staff 1 to call law
enforcement. Staff 1 called law enforcement due to Youth A and
Youth B fighting. After Staff 1 called law enforcement, Youth A
and Youth B began fighting again. Youth A went toward Youth B
and Staff 2 and Staff 3 placed Youth A in a restraint by hooking
her arms. Staff 1 did not recall the name of the SCM restraint Staff
2 and Staff 3 placed Youth A in but described it as Youth A’s arms
being hooked on each side by Staff 2 and Staff 3 and Youth A’s
arms being out to the side. Staff 1 was talking to Youth B in her
bedroom doorway. Staff 1 reported when he placed Youth A
against the wall and had his arms out against the wall securing
Youth A in his arms that this was not a trained SCM technique.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was successfully restrained once during
the incident by Staff 2 and Staff 3. Youth B was not restrained at
all. Youth B was escorted away from Youth A during the fights.
5

Staff 1 reported he was telling the other youth on the pod not to
intervene and to go to their bedrooms however the other youth
were not listening. The other youth did intervene and separated
Youth A and Youth B during the altercations.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were talking,
and the conversation spiraled out of control resulting in a fight.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to separate Youth A and Youth B by
standing between with no hands-on Youth A or Youth B. Youth A
and Youth B were able to get around Staff 1 and Staff 2 and
began fighting. Staff 1 called Staff 3 to come assist on the pod.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 restrained Youth A and explained he did
not see the restraint however he assumed Staff 1 was restraining
Youth A as Youth A was saying “get off me”. Staff 1 had Youth A
in the corner in a restraint and described the restraint as Staff 1
having his arms over Youth A shoulders and his arms locked
behind Youth A’s back. Staff 2 used proximity control with his
arms out to get Youth B into her bedroom. Staff 3 arrived on the
pod. Staff 3 assisted Staff 1 with Youth A. Staff 2 did not see what
Staff 1 and Staff 3 were doing as he was trying to verbally
deescalate Youth B. Youth B was able to move around Staff 2 and
went to fight Youth A. Staff 2 reported he placed Youth B in a
standing upper torso restraint. Staff 2 did not see Staff 1 place
Youth A against the wall. Youth A and Youth B calmed down and
Staff 1 released Youth A. Staff 1 came to assist Staff 2 with Youth
B. Staff 1 took over the restraint with Youth B for Staff 2. Staff 2
reported he and Staff 3 restrained Youth A and were able to get
her into a two person SCM hold and turn her away from Youth B.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 held Youth A in a restraint for approximately six
minutes. Staff 2 had difficulty recalling details of the incident as he
shared there was a lot going on. Staff 2 reported law enforcement
was called as the situation was out of control and it is the facilities
policy and procedure as Youth A and Youth B were fighting. Staff
2 reported other youth on the pod did intervene when Youth A and
Youth B were fighting. Staff 2 did not say anything to the other
youth about intervening as he was focused on the situation. Staff
2 recalled Youth A grabbing a chair at which time Staff 2 reported
he told Youth A to put the chair down. Staff 2 reported he moved
the chair out of the way. Staff 2 reported he did not go hands on
with Youth A when she had the chair. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was restrained four times that evening, and Youth B was
restrained two or three times. Staff 2 reported he lost count of the
number of times restraints occurred that night.
6

Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023. Staff 3 was called from the pod he was working to
come assist Staff 1 and Staff 2. When Staff 3 arrived the first time,
Youth A had a shelf that she was trying to hit Youth B with. Staff 3
removed the shelf from Youth A’s hands. Staff 1 had Youth B in
the corner and was facing her. Staff 1 was talking to Youth B and
did not have any hands-on Youth B. Staff 1 was standing with his
hands in a normal position at his side. Youth A went into Youth B’s
bedroom and Staff 2 and Staff 3 were able to escort Youth A out
of Youth B’s bedroom by placing their hands on the middle of
Youth A’s back and guiding her out of the bedroom. Youth A and
Youth B stopped fighting and Staff 3 left the pod. Staff 3 was
called to come assist for a second time. Staff 2 had Youth A in a
one arm hold and described this as Staff 2 holding one of his
hands around Youth A’s wrist and the other hand on her shoulder.
Youth A was “flailing” her other arm. Staff 3 stepped in and
secured Youth A's other arm and Staff 2 and Staff 3 escorted
Youth A to the corner of the pod. Staff 2 and Staff 3 were
attempting to verbally deescalate Youth A. Youth A calmed down.
Staff 3 reported he did not recall law enforcement being called.
Staff 3 reported the incident was very chaotic and it was hard to
remember all the details. Staff 3 recalled a youth grabbing a chair
at one point however did not recall who. Staff 3 reported Youth A
was placed in a restraint per SCM technique by him and Staff 2
and was only restrained one time that he was aware of. Staff 3
reported the other youth on the pod were trying to stop Youth A
and Youth B from fighting. The other youth on the pod were told
by Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 to go to their bedrooms and not
intervene however would not follow the directive.
The complainant is the facilities assigned consultant as
during restraint reviews the incident report documented the
facility documented a restraint and the narrative indicated a
restraint technique that is not per the facilities restraint
model.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 168400213 dated 11/22/2023 at 12:15am: Staff 1
hooked Youth A’s left arm and placed Youth A against the
wall for one minute. Youth A agreed she was calm and
ready to be released. The incident report indicates a
standing restraint occurred to prevent injury to others.
Youth A was in the standing restraint from 12:15am until
12:20am.
7

• Youth Opportunity Incident Report dated 11/22/2023 is
consistent with Michigan Department of Health & Human
Services Incident Report 168400213.
• Youth Opportunity Osceola Youth Center Safe Crisis
Management and Physical Intervention Policy and
Procedure:. Emergency Physical interventions shall be
used only when reasonably necessary to prevent immanent
risk of harm to the youth, self, or others or when there is a
serious situation that places a youth or others at serious
threat of violence or injury if no intervention occurs. SCM
Matrix shall always be utilized when considering
intervention techniques.
• Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3’s personnel file: Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 3 had no disciplinary record. Staff 1 and Staff 2
completed SCM training on 10/27/2023. Staff 3 completed
SCM training on 10/5/2023.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 11/22/2023 in the pod living room area was
viewed on 11/30/2023. There are several times during the
video that it is unclear what is occurring as the video camera
angle has several blind spot areas. Youth A and Youth B are on
the pod. Youth A and Youth B start charging at one another. Staff
1 steps in between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 is facing Youth B
and is using proximity control of moving his body in front of Youth
B to keep Youth B from going back toward Youth A. Youth D is
standing in front of Youth A and is holding Youth A back from
going toward Youth B. Staff 2 begins using proximity control by
standing in front of Youth A. Youth A and Youth D cannot be seen
on the video due to the angle of the camera. Youth B picks up a
bottle of water and another peer comes over to intervene with
Youth B and is standing in front of Youth B while Staff 1 is also
standing in front of Youth B. The peer takes the water bottle from
Youth B. Youth A continues to try to move around her peers and
Staff 2 to get to Youth B. Youth A gets past Staff 2 and is stopped
by Youth D who is attempting to hold Youth A back. Staff 2 stands
in between and is continuing to do proximity control by placing
himself in between Youth A and Youth B. Youth A is being held by
Youth D and another peer and Staff 1 has Youth B in proximity
control in the corner which is unclear his position due to the video
camera angle. Staff 1 turns away from Youth B and is facing to
see Youth A being held back by her two peers and Staff 2
standing with his arms out to stop Youth A and the peers from
getting any closer to Youth B. Staff 1 goes over toward Staff 2,
Youth A and her peers who are holding her back. Youth B runs
8

from the corner and tries to hit Youth A. Staff 1 secures Youth B in
a single person upper torso restraint however is unsuccessful as
Youth B’s left arm is not secured and Staff 1 begins stepping
Youth B back and is able to secure his arm as moving backwards.
Staff 1 and Youth B then move back toward the wall and are off
camera. Staff 2 continues use proximity control and then attempts
to place Youth A in an upper torso restraint however is
unsuccessful as Youth A pulls away and gets out of the restraint
and goes toward Youth B. It is unclear what is occurring as Youth
A, Youth B, Staff 1, and Staff 2 are in the corner which is out of
the video camera angle to be seen. Youth B comes out of the
corner with a peer holding her and guiding Youth B to her
bedroom. Youth B stands in her bedroom doorway and is talking
to Staff 2. Youth A and Staff 1 move out of the corner as Youth A
is trying to go toward Youth B’s bedroom and Staff 1 is using
proximity control. Staff 1 appears to be talking to Youth A however
cannot be heard due to no sound on the camera footage and Staff
2 is talking to Youth B. Youth A and Staff 1 move and can no
longer be seen on the video. Youth A and Staff 1 come back into
the video camera footage and Youth A is carrying a chair and sets
it down by the bedroom door. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are standing
facing Youth A at the bedroom door and Youth B is moving
around the pod. Youth D is standing in front of Youth B and
appears to be trying to keep Youth B from going toward the
bedroom door where Youth A is with Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 2
turns around toward Youth B. Youth B goes around Youth D to the
bedroom door where Youth A is standing. Staff 2 is facing Youth B
using proximity control to stay between Youth B and Youth A.
Youth B goes up to confront Youth A and a peer comes running
over to stop Youth B. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are standing in front of
Youth A facing Youth A. Staff 2 turns and faces the pod area while
he and Staff 1 are using proximity control to keep Youth A in the
corner with no hands touching Youth A. Youth B is in the middle
of the pod with a peer holding her back. Youth B again walks
toward Youth A and Staff 2 uses proximity control by positioning
his body not to allow Youth B to get to Youth A. Youth A runs and
gets around Staff 2 to get to Youth B. Youth A and Youth B begin
fighting again. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are in trying to separate Youth A
and Youth B as well as two peers run in to separate Youth A and
Youth B. It is difficult to see on the video however it looks as
though Staff 1 secures Youth B standing upper torso restraint and
steps out of the video camera angle and is unable to be seen.
Staff 2 attempts to place Youth A in a standing upper torso
however does not appear to secure the hold and Youth A is able
to get away from him and move out of sight on the camera. Staff
1 moves back into the camera angle with no hands-on Youth B
9

and is using proximity control to move her back into the corner of
the pod. Youth A gets a chair and throws the chair. Staff 2
attempts to grab the chair before it is thrown however is unable to
get the chair. After Youth A throws the chair, she is able to get a
hold of one of the chair legs as the chair is upside down. Staff 2
attempts to get Youth A in an upper torso however he dropped his
arm and Staff 2 is unable to secure Youth A’s arms. Staff 2 wraps
his arms around Youth A’s waist to try to turn Youth A away from
Staff 1 and Youth B as Youth A has the chair in her grip and is
trying to throw the chair again. Staff 1 turns facing Youth A and
Staff 2. Staff 2 continues to hold Youth A by the waist and then
tries to go in for the upper torso restraint by moving his arms up to
her shoulder however does not do an upper torso restraint as Staff
2 is holding Youth A with his hands on her shoulder area. Youth A
releases her grip on the chair as Staff 1 is also holding the chair
and Staff 2 releases his hands from Youth A’s shoulders. Staff 1
continues to talk to Youth A as Staff 2 moves the chair and Staff 3
comes in. Youth B goes to her bedroom. Youth A then walks out
of the camera angle.
Analysis Initial Allegation:
The facility is found in compliance as per interviews Staff 2
attempted to place Youth A in an upper body torso restraint
however was unsuccessful. Staff 1 stepped in and used his arms
by placing his arms under Youth A’s arms and with his arms
straight out to guide Youth A to the corner. Staff 1 did not have
Youth A in a restraint and was not restricting Youth A’s free
movement. Per PA 116 this was not a restraint as Youth A had
free movement of her body. In reviewing the video footage, this
was unable to be seen as the video camera angle does not show
where this occurred.
Additional Findings:
The facility is found in noncompliance for Staff 2’s restraint with
Youth A as Staff 2 was holding Youth A around the waist as he
was unable to secure Youth A’s arms in the upper torso restraint
when Youth A was attempting to throw the chair which is not a
trained SCM hold technique.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C000770SI dated 10/18/23; CAP Approved 11/14/23
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health Status Assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
10

shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation 1. Incident report was not submitted within 24 hours of the
incident occurring and not approved within 72 hours of the
incident occurring.
2. The facility did not complete incident reports on the
prescribed form for the restraint with Youth A and Staff 2
and Youth A and Staff 2 and Staff 3.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/30/2023. Youth A was restrained by Staff 2 and Staff 3 and
described the restraint as Staff 2 and Staff 3 “hooking” her arms.
Youth A reported she picked up a chair at one point during the
fight and was going to throw it at Youth B however was restrained
by staff. Youth A did not recall which staff restrained her. Youth A
was unable to recall how she was restrained. Youth A reported
she was restrained twice during the fight with Youth B.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/30/2023. Youth B reported Youth A was restrained by Staff 2
and Staff 3. Staff 2 had one of Youth A’s arms and Staff 3 had
Youth A’s other arm. Youth B did not recall how Staff 2 and Staff 3
were holding Youth A’s arms. Youth A was held in the corner by
Staff 2 and Staff 3 in the restraint.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/30/2023. Youth C recalled Youth A being restrained however
did not remember any details of the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 attempted to restrain Youth A
however Staff 1 did not see how he attempted to restrain her.
Youth A grabbed a chair and attempted to throw the chair at Staff
1. Staff 2 moved his arms to block the chair from being thrown.
Youth A grabbed the chair again. Staff 1 was able to get a hold of
the chair and held the chair down on the ground so Youth A could
not pick the chair up to throw it again. Staff 2 had a hold of Youth
A at this time however Staff 1 did not recall how Staff 2 was
holding Youth A. Staff 2 released Youth A and Youth A went and
sat on the couch. Youth A and Youth B began fighting again.
Youth A went toward Youth B and Staff 2 and Staff 3 placed Youth
A in a restraint by hooking her arms. Staff 1 did not recall the
name of the SCM restraint Staff 2 and Staff 3 placed Youth A in
but described it as Youth A’s arms being hooked on each side by
11

Staff 2 and Staff 3 and Youth A’s arms being out to the side. Staff
1 reported Youth A was successfully restrained once during the
incident by Staff 2 and Staff 3.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023. Staff 2 reported he placed Youth B in a standing
upper torso restraint. Staff 2 reported he and Staff 3 restrained
Youth A and were able to get her into a two person SCM hold.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 held Youth A in a restraint for approximately six
minutes. Staff 2 had difficulty recalling details of the incident as he
shared there was a lot going on. Staff 2 recalled Youth A grabbing
a chair at which time Staff 2 reported he told Youth A to put the
chair down. Staff 2 reported he moved the chair out of the way.
Staff 2 reported he did not go hands on with Youth A when she
had the chair.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023. Staff 3 was called to come assist for a second time.
Staff 2 had Youth A in a one arm hold and described this as Staff
2 holding one of his hands around Youth A’s wrist and the other
hand on her shoulder. Youth A was “flailing” her other arm. Staff 3
stepped in and secured Youth A's other arm and Staff 2 and Staff
3 escorted Youth A to the corner of the pod. Staff 2 and Staff 3
were attempting to verbally deescalate Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 11/22/2023 in the pod living room area was
viewed on 11/30/2023. There are several times during the
video that it is unclear what is occurring as the video camera
angle has several blind spot areas. After Youth A throws the
chair, she is able to get a hold of one of the chair legs as the chair
is upside down. Staff 2 attempts to get Youth A in an upper torso
however he dropped his arm and Staff 2 is unable to secure Youth
A’s arms. Staff 2 wraps his arms around Youth A’s waist to try to
turn Youth A away from Staff 1 and Youth B as Youth A has the
